timeline.bodyText: @marceloamadeu please simplify this to be like the other tests (without using this lambda and ScalarHasValue)
timeline.author: victornoel

timeline.bodyText: @marceloamadeu can you replac this with the HasSize matcher?
timeline.author: victornoel

timeline.bodyText: @marceloamadeu why not use the HasSize matcher as proposed?
timeline.author: victornoel
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -122,7 +123,7 @@ public void sensesChangesInMap() throws Exception {
         new Assertion<>(
             "Must sense the changes in the underlying map",
             props.value().size(),
-            Matchers.not(Matchers.equalTo(props.value().size()))
+            new IsNot<>(new IsEqual<>(props.value().size()))

replies.bodyText:
@victornoel I couldn't use HasSize ... Any idea how I can fix the error:
new IsNot<>(new HasSize(props.value().size()))
[ERROR]  cannot infer type arguments for org.llorllale.cactoos.matchers.Assertion<>                                                                               
[ERROR]  reason: inference variable T has incompatible bounds
[ERROR]  equality constraints: T,java.lang.Iterable<?>
[ERROR]  lower bounds: java.lang.Integer

Tks
replies.author: marceloamadeu

replies.bodyText:
@marceloamadeu HasSize takes a collection or an iterable, not the result of calling size(), check its signature.
Also can you update your comment to specify who (me) you are talking to? It will have impact on the quality assessment done on my work at the end of my review.
replies.author: victornoel

replies.bodyText: @marceloamadeu or sorry, it's not exactly true, the first argument of the assertion should be a collection or iterable, not the argument of HasSize
replies.author: victornoel

replies.bodyText:
@victornoel Sorry ... I made the correction.

Also can you update your comment to specify who (me) you are talking to? It will have impact on the quality assessment done on my work at the end of my review.
replies.author: marceloamadeu
